912560021656936448.text: 32/ But, the fixed cost network access model will endure for high quality IRL networks, and innovative universities will adapt.

912559900764422144.text: 31/ In sum, higher education will certainly be impacted by technology in the coming years and will be forced to respond.

912559803423002625.text: 30/ Unknown direction at t=0 is less compatible with variable cost networks unless you have a very strong signal of ability.

912559728714067968.text: 29/ IRL network access is a key ingredient to success in this laboratory.

912559628608708609.text: 28/ Where it’s acceptable to enter with a wide open mind at t=0 and the intention of finding direction by t=T.

912559479845044225.text: 27/ Not everyone will find their passion at a university, but many do. In this way it acts as a laboratory for self-actualization.

912559408227295233.text: 26/ Once people figure out what they are passionate about, desire to learn is innate.

912559330708226049.text: 25/ What to study and how to study are often variables without known values.  This is directly related to the scarcity in desire to learn.

912559258327162881.text: 24/ They have an answer for this question when asked, because it is asked frequently, but in their heart of hearts they’re not really sure.

912559181458153473.text: 23/ For better or worse, many (but not all) students show up not really knowing what they want to do with their life.

912559114319945728.text: 22/ Finally, the laboratory for self-actualization is a non-trivial part of the value prop at universities.

912559047924113408.text: 21/ Do online alumni feel the same connection to recent graduates as Harvard MBAs do? Legit question, I don’t have the answer.

912558970794950656.text: 20/ Further, the strength of connection between nodes in the university network comes from enduring a shared experience IRL.

912558869322149888.text: 19/ Universities are non-profits after all, plus subsidized by donors so current students don’t bear full cost.

912558796223823872.text: 18/ Can fixed cost access to high quality networks IRL can be done substantially cheaper at scale? Willing to be convinced.

912558712811692032.text: 17/ High quality networks are costly to procure because high quality nodes value their time highly. Time is not infinitely divisible IRL.

912558613813616640.text: 16/ Quick side note: blockchain tokens are going to facilitate the variable option for those that can’t afford the ex ante fixed cost.

912558523648638981.text: 15/ e.g. 7% of your lifetime earnings, or $150k paid up front? Not even close for high earners.

912558449912713216.text: 14/ Which cost model would you choose to access a high value network, fixed or variable? Depends on expected outcome.

912558265229176834.text: 13/ Universities are fixed cost networks, paid ex ante (with an ex post variable option in the form of philanthropy).

912558192684548096.text: 12/ Y Combinator runs a very, very valuable network.  It's variable cost network, paid ex post.  High performing alumni end up paying a lot.

912557982713389056.text: 11/ Clearly, @airbnb founders have also done well.  They generated a lot of value from the network. My point is the cost model.

912557881173491712.text: 10/ Network access exists elsewhere, but it's not costless.  Consider the cost of Y Combinator network access for founders of @airbnb

912557676936044545.text: 9/ Let’s dig into network effects first: faculty/mentor networks, peer networks, alumni networks. Students are buying network access.

912557601430290432.text: 8/ The other components of value are more interesting.

912557536754012160.text: 7/ Universities will employ these models for a portion of the curriculum and pass cost-savings to students. Already happening.

912557444017950720.text: 6/ There is no question that content and credentialing are digitally replicable at a much lower cost than traditional classroom education.

912557306184851456.text: 5/ I listed them in that order deliberately.  It is the order of replicability by digital solutions.

912557132813295622.text: 4/ Student value prop: 1) content, 2) credentialing, 3) network access, and 4) laboratory for self-actualization.

912557049405255682.text: 3/ Where does the value of higher education reside? Different answers for students and faculty. Only going to tackle student side here.

912556962453143552.text: 2/ My dual identities as a tech-optimist and b-school professor have been debating this issue for some time.

890357220646330368.text: 11/ Crypto ETFs will eventually be allowed.  Just a matter of time and putting more structure in place. US retail will have to be patient.
